newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Shanghai newspapers - July 9.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Shanghai newspapers - July 9.

text.p: Following is a summary of major political and business stories in local newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Shanghai. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy.
- SHANGHAI SECURITIES NEWS - The Shanghai stock exchange will begin to move its operations to Pudong in August.

- State debt trading turnover on the Shanghai and Shenzhen stock exchanges fell by about a half in June against May due to Beijing's ban on state banks trading state debt contracts on the exchanges and regional trading centres.
- Combined market capitalisation of the Shanghai and Shenzhen stock exchanges rose by 69 percent to 1.7 trillion yuan by the end of June against the end of last year.
- BUSINESS NEWS - The State Development Bank has offered three billion yuan in loans for the construction of Shanghai's second international airport based in Pudong.
- Total foreign investment in the Pudong New Area increased by a year-on-year 10.8 percent to $2.76 billion in the first half of this year.
